thread.title: Well-Wishers Packed Southern Baptist Church In Harlem During Recent Gala Anniversary Dinner Celebrating 93 Years Of Fellowship
thread.title_full: Well-Wishers Packed Southern Baptist Church In Harlem During Recent Gala Anniversary Dinner Celebrating 93 Years Of Fellowship

author: prbuzz.com
title: Well-Wishers Packed Southern Baptist Church In Harlem During Recent Gala Anniversary Dinner Celebrating 93 Years Of Fellowship
text:
For Immediate Release:
(HARLEM, NY) - Parishioners, local ministers and community leaders enjoyed soul food, gospel music and praise dancers as they celebrated the 93rd Anniversary of Southern Baptist Church in Harlem, New York.
Senior Pastor Keith Roberson told the audience of more than 100 people who filled the church’s banquet hall that God was still using the church to bless the lives of parishioners and the greater Harlem community.
“I am glad that we are here to celebrate a remarkable achievement and continue to fellowship together after all these years,” Roberson said. “A lot of churches, unfortunately, have closed their doors because of economic hardships but the Lord has continued to smile on Southern Baptist Church for more than 93 years.”
Roberson, who has pastored Southern Baptist Church for more than eight years, said the formula for the church’s success and longevity was rooted in faith.
“God is still able and He is showing us to do the things that we are capable of doing,” Roberson said. “We have kept the faith in fellowship which is why I believe the church continues to thrive after 93 years.”
The celebration featured prayer, foot stomping entertainment, including praise dancing and gospel musical performances by church members.
Anniversary Event Chairperson Angie Colington, said: “I grew up in the church and have been a member for more than 38 years. I have seen everything throughout the years and I am very proud to be a member here. I am honored to be able to serve as the anniversary chairperson and give something back to the church and community I love.”
Anniversary Event Co-Chair Elisha Thompson, said, “This was an amazing event and the turnout shows just how important the church is to this community.”
The church is located at 12-16 W. 108th St., between Central Park West and Manhattan Ave., with a membership of about 350 parishioners. (It is not to be confused with the Southern Baptist Convention, a national association of churches).
In 2012, Southern Baptist Church made history when the Rev. Eva Duzant was ordained as the first female minister in its then 90-year history.
Duzant, now assistant to Pastor Roberson, said, “Southern Baptist Church is a special place with a long and distinguished history of fellowship and serving the greater Harlem community.
“I am honored to serve and worship here,” Duzant said. “We have all been blessed by Southern for 93 years and God is still working through His people here.”
-30-
For more information about Southern Baptist Church, Contact: Eva Duzant | (212) 663-6549.
